quotes: Yudhoyono had one more stint overseas when he became Indonesia's chief military observer of the United Nation Peacekeeping Force in Bosnia in 1995–96.
He served in this position until 1997, when he was appointed chief of staff for social-political affairs.

During the days which would lead to Suharto's resignation in May 1998, Yudhoyono and pro-reform ABRI officers conducted meetings and discussions with Nurcholish Madjid, a secular pro-reform Muslim leader.
Nevertheless, the pressure eventually become too much for Suharto, who resigned on 21 May 1998.
In 1999, ABRI was renamed TNI and the Indonesian National Police (Polri) was split off.

organizations.name: United Nation Peacekeeping Force
quotes: Yudhoyono had one more stint overseas when he became Indonesia's chief military observer of the United Nation Peacekeeping Force in Bosnia in 1995–96.

organizations.name: KODAM Jaya
quotes: When Yudhoyono returned to Indonesia, he was made KODAM Jaya chief of staff before being appointed as KODAM II/Sriwijaya commander.

organizations.name: KODAM II/Sriwijaya
quotes: When Yudhoyono returned to Indonesia, he was made KODAM Jaya chief of staff before being appointed as KODAM II/Sriwijaya commander.

organizations.name: ABRI
quotes: At the same time, he was also appointed chairman of the ABRI Faction in the People's Consultative Assembly General Session and participated in Suharto's election to a seventh term as president.

roles.title: chief of staff for territorial affairs
quotes: To de-emphasise ABRI's political role, Yudhoyono's chief of staff for social-political affairs was renamed chief of staff for territorial affairs and in 1999, ABRI was renamed TNI and the Indonesian National Police (Polri) was split off.

roles.title: mining and energy minister
quotes: Yudhoyono was appointed mining and energy minister in the cabinet of President Abdurrahman Wahid in 1999.
Yudhoyono had one more stint overseas when he became Indonesia's chief military observer of the United Nation Peacekeeping Force in Bosnia in 1995–96.
In this position, Yudhoyono was responsible for military operations in southern Sumatra.
